1.title: Burgers

episode of.title: Three Ways to Eat: Ottawa (TV Series 2016– )

1.plot: Burgers are back, and the craze is sweeping Ottawa. Standard pub-fare doesn't cut it any more on the foodie scene, so Caroline finds three burger joints that are taking two buns and a patty to a whole new level.

2.title: Brunch

episode of.title: Three Ways to Eat: Ottawa (TV Series 2016– )

2.plot: On weekends, we brunch. From greasy comfort foods to special occasion destinations, Caroline takes us from a farm to a pancake shack for the ultimate morning meals in Ottawa.

3.title: Seafood

episode of.title: Three Ways to Eat: Ottawa (TV Series 2016– )

3.plot: Holy Mackrel. Who knew Ottawa had so many great seafood options? Street vendors and big spenders show Caroline where to catch the best fish dishes in the city.

4.title: Vegetarian

episode of.title: Three Ways to Eat: Ottawa (TV Series 2016– )

4.plot: You can make friends with salad. Caroline gives up meat but refuses to sacrifice flavor as she hunts down the best vegetarian bowls and buffets in Ottawa.

5.title: Sweets

episode of.title: Three Ways to Eat: Ottawa (TV Series 2016– )

5.plot: Sweet Caroline. Good times have never tasted so good. Caroline indulges in some of the city's tastiest pastries and favourite frozen treats.

6.title: Tacos

episode of.title: Three Ways to Eat: Ottawa (TV Series 2016– )

6.plot: Arriba. Caroline has a shell of a good time stuffing her plate with Ottawa's tastiest tacos from a street-side hut, a subterranean hideout, and an upscale trailblazer.

imdb.plot outline: On your mark, get set, gorge. Take a fast paced tour of the city as Caroline Dumont finds three Ottawa restaurants that have a different spin on the same dish. From staples like burgers, pizza and poutine, to specialty options in vegetarian, seafood and small plates, Caroline finds something for every taste.

plot: Take a fast paced tour of the city as Caroline Dumont finds three Ottawa restaurants that have a different spin on the same dish.::Anonymous

On your mark, get set, gorge. Take a fast paced tour of the city as Caroline Dumont finds three Ottawa restaurants that have a different spin on the same dish. From staples like burgers, pizza and poutine, to specialty options in vegetarian, seafood and small plates, Caroline finds something for every taste.
